intro: Cinchona lancifolia var. vera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces dark red berries that contain the seeds, and it is notable for its historical use in the production of quinine, a compound used to treat malaria. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional medicine and botanical research.
